thread.title: Berlin: Morena Baccarin Joins 'Elliot: The Littlest Reindeer' Voice Cast
thread.title_full: Berlin: Morena Baccarin Joins 'Elliot: The Littlest Reindeer' Voice Cast

title: Berlin: Morena Baccarin Joins 'Elliot: The Littlest Reindeer' Voice Cast
text:
Morena Baccarin has joined the voice cast of Elliot: The Littlest Reindeer. 
The former Homeland star will play Corkie, the intrepid journalist determined to get the scoop on Santa's North Pole tryouts in the Christmas animated underdog tale. Baccarin joins Josh Hutcherson, Samantha Bee, John Cleese and Martin Short in the pic from Awesometown Entertainment being shopped in Berlin by Double Dutch International. 
Elliot finds Santa Claus reindeer Blitzen announcing his retirement on Dec. 21, giving Elliot, a miniature horse, just three days during North Pole tryouts to fulfill his lifelong dream to earn a spot on the legendary Christmas sleigh ride. "I really enjoyed the story," Baccarin said. "The idea that with enough perseverance and team spirit you can change the expected and surpass the norm. And it's always a plus to be in something your kids can watch!" 
Elliot is produced by Lucas Lynette-Krech, and written and directed by Jennifer Westcott. Executive producer credits are shared by Dan Krech, Victoria Westcott, Mike Sears, Michael Emerson and Moring. 
Baccarin earned an Emmy nomination for her performance in Homeland , on which she starred for the drama's first three seasons. Her credits include Gotham, Deadpool, Firefly and V . 
Baccarin is represented by UTA and Seven Summits Pictures and Management. Elliot is the first from a deal between DDI And Awesometown to co-produce two to three animated features annually budgeted in the $10 million-$15 million range.
